title: Basic Usage
content: The src attribute is used to set the default cropping image source path, and the cropvisible attribute is used to control whether the cropping dialog box is visible.
findIntroStr: Crop image cropping, preview, JPG and PNG formats are supported. You can manually adjust the selected avatar area when browsing images.

title: Aspect-to-height ratio of the crop box
content: You can use the aspect-ratio attribute to set the aspect ratio of the crop box. The default value is 16 / 9. You can also set the aspect ratio of the trim box by calling the setAspectRatio method. The center attribute can be used to set whether the crop frame is in the center of the image.
findIntroStr: Crop image cropping, preview, JPG and PNG formats are supported. You can manually adjust the selected avatar area when browsing images.

title: Minimum width and height of the crop box
content: Set the minimum width and height of the cropping frame through the min-crop-box-width and min-crop-box-height attributes. After this parameter is set, the width and height of the cropping box cannot be adjusted after the width and height are adjusted to the minimum value. Set the minimum width and height of the container through the mmin-container-width and min-container-height attributes.
findIntroStr: Crop image cropping, preview, JPG and PNG formats are supported. You can manually adjust the selected avatar area when browsing images.

title: Do not display the grid background.
content: When background is set to false, the grid background of the container is not displayed.
findIntroStr: Crop image cropping, preview, JPG and PNG formats are supported. You can manually adjust the selected avatar area when browsing images.

title: Do not display dotted lines.
content: Setting guides to false will cancel the dotted line above the crop box.
findIntroStr: Crop image cropping, preview, JPG and PNG formats are supported. You can manually adjust the selected avatar area when browsing images.

title: Do not display modal
content: Setting modal to false cancels the display of the modal layer above the image below the crop box.
findIntroStr: Crop image cropping, preview, JPG and PNG formats are supported. You can manually adjust the selected avatar area when browsing images.

title: View mode
content:
You can set the view mode of the crop box through the view-mode attribute. There are four options: 0, 1, 2, and 3. The default value is 0.

view-mode option description

0: The crop box can be moved outside the image. 1: The crop box can only be moved within the image. 2: The image is not completely covered in the container. A gap may appear on one side when the image is zoomed out. 3: fills the entire container with an image.
findIntroStr: Crop image cropping, preview, JPG and PNG formats are supported. You can manually adjust the selected avatar area when browsing images.

title: Drag Mode
content:
You can set the drag mode of the crop box through the drag-mode attribute. There are three options: crop, move, and none. The default value is crop.

drag-mode Option Description

crop: After the cropping box is canceled, hold down the left mouse button and drag it in the image area to generate a new cropping box. move: After the cropping box is canceled, hold down the left mouse button to move the image. none: After the crop box is canceled, the image cannot be cropped or moved. movable specifies whether an image can be moved. The default value is true.
findIntroStr: Crop image cropping, preview, JPG and PNG formats are supported. You can manually adjust the selected avatar area when browsing images.

title: Automatically Cropped Area
content: During initialization, the auto-crop-area attribute can be used to set the area of the cropping box. The default value is 0.8. This parameter is valid only when auto-crop is set to true.
findIntroStr: Crop image cropping, preview, JPG and PNG formats are supported. You can manually adjust the selected avatar area when browsing images.

title: Obtain container data
content: Invoke the getContainerData method to obtain the container size data.
findIntroStr: Crop image cropping, preview, JPG and PNG formats are supported. You can manually adjust the selected avatar area when browsing images.

title: Obtain clip box data
content: Invoke the getCropBoxData method to obtain the position and size of the clip box.
findIntroStr: Crop image cropping, preview, JPG and PNG formats are supported. You can manually adjust the selected avatar area when browsing images.

title: Obtain the cropped image data
content: Invoke the getCroppedCanvas method to obtain the cropped image data. Use the toDataURL method to convert the cropped image data to Base64 image data. Use the toBlob method to generate Blob image data.
findIntroStr: Crop image cropping, preview, JPG and PNG formats are supported. You can manually adjust the selected avatar area when browsing images.

title: Obtain crop area data
content: Invoke the getData method to obtain the position and size of the cropping area.
findIntroStr: Crop image cropping, preview, JPG and PNG formats are supported. You can manually adjust the selected avatar area when browsing images.

title: Obtain Image Data
content: Invoke the getImageData method to obtain the image position, size, and other related data. To obtain the canvas position and size data, call the getCanvasData method.
findIntroStr: Crop image cropping, preview, JPG and PNG formats are supported. You can manually adjust the selected avatar area when browsing images.

title: Replace Image
content: Invoke the replace method to replace the image src and rebuild the cropper. The rotatable attribute is used to control image rotation. The default value is true.
findIntroStr: Crop image cropping, preview, JPG and PNG formats are supported. You can manually adjust the selected avatar area when browsing images.

title: Enlarge Image
content: For details, see the following example.
findIntroStr: Crop image cropping, preview, JPG and PNG formats are supported. You can manually adjust the selected avatar area when browsing images.

title: Scale when the mouse wheel is used to zoom in or out an image
content: zoom-on-wheel attribute is set to true, you can use the wheel-zoom-ratio attribute to set the scaling ratio. The default value is 0.1.
findIntroStr: Crop image cropping, preview, JPG and PNG formats are supported. You can manually adjust the selected avatar area when browsing images.

title: Disable the mouse wheel to zoom in or out the image.
content: After the zoom-on-wheel attribute is set to false, the image cannot be zoomed in or out by scrolling the mouse wheel.
findIntroStr: Crop image cropping, preview, JPG and PNG formats are supported. You can manually adjust the selected avatar area when browsing images.

title: ready event
content: When a cropper instance is completely built, the ready event is triggered.
findIntroStr: Crop image cropping, preview, JPG and PNG formats are supported. You can manually adjust the selected avatar area when browsing images.

title: Crop box method event
content: When a cropper instance is completely built, the disable method is triggered to disable the cropping box. When the enable method is triggered to enable the cropping box
findIntroStr: Crop image cropping, preview, JPG and PNG formats are supported. You can manually adjust the selected avatar area when browsing images.

title: Cutout Event
content:
TIP

Description: The cropstart event is triggered when the canvas or clipping box starts to change. The cropmove event is triggered when the canvas or clipping box is changed. The cropen event is triggered when the canvas or clipping box ends. dEvent The crop event is triggered when the canvas or crop box changes. The getCanvasData event is triggered to obtain the position and size data of the canvas (image wrapper)
findIntroStr: Crop image cropping, preview, JPG and PNG formats are supported. You can manually adjust the selected avatar area when browsing images.
